instruction: How much time does it take to grow potatoes?
output: It takes between 10 and 12 weeks to grow potatoes, depending on the variety. The potatoes need to be kept in the ground at least 7 weeks after they have flowered to reach full maturity. The soil temperature also plays an important role in the growth rate of potatoes. The ideal soil temperature range is 50-60 °F (10-16 °C). Warmer temperatures speed up the process and cooler temperatures slow it down.
